text: ( CNN ) Two jurors in Bill Cosby's assault trial offered differing accounts of their deadlocked deliberations that underscore how differently they may have viewed the case. However, a different juror told CNN affiliate WPXI that jurors were in a ` ` true deadlock'' and that votes were generally split along 7 - 5 or 5 - 7 votes for most of the deliberations. Both jurors spoke on the condition of anonymity because jurors were told not to comment on the proceedings inside the jury room. The jury room insights came less than a week after the trial judge declared a mistrial in Cosby's case, as jurors reported being hopelessly deadlocked over more than 50 hours of deliberations.
